channel.title: Adding ::Noclip comand?

item.title: Adding ::Noclip comand?
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

Red Knox:

I was guessing, because the colons aren’t required, they’re already put in without typing them. No need to rage on me for at least trying, when you didn’t even solve his problem. smh.

I wasn’t raging in the slightest. I was curious why you would think removing two colons would solve a cannot find symbol error. Your logic is flawed as well since you didn’t solve his problem in the slightest either.

Read full topic

remove the “::” should fix it

Why would removing that fix it? Having 2 colons before it has nothing to do with that error.

item.title: Adding ::Noclip comand?
item.dc:creator: @FromAutumnToAshes FromAutumnToAshes
item.description:
@FromAutumnToAshes wrote:

Sup guys, im trying to add a Clientsided noclip command to my server, I tried puttiing it in my client.java but i get the following error whenever i compile:

client.java:4743: error: cannot find symbol if(inputString.equals("::noclip")) { ^ symbol: variable inputString location: class client

Here is my code i am using:

if(inputString.equals("::noclip")) { for(int k1 = 0; k1 < 4; k1++) { for(int i2 = 1; i2 < 103; i2++) { } } }

Read full topic
